newsitem.title: UK: Brokers cut BTR profit forecasts by 10 pct.
newsitem.headline: Brokers cut BTR profit forecasts by 10 pct.

text.p: Conglomerates analysts reduced profit estimates for BTR Plc by about ten percent on Thursday following a profit warning.
Forecasts for this year were cut to about 1,200 million stg from 1,330-1,350 million and for next year to about 1,300-1,320 from 1,465-1,470, they said.
The industrial holdings company said earlier that the strong pound and weak conditions in key markets would dent sales and operating profits.
The shares fell to 240-1/2p, down 27p, by 0933 GMT.
On the basis of current exchange rates, sales are expected to fall by about 300 million stg and operating profit by about 35 million stg compared with the first half of 1996, the company said.
First half operating profits would be below last year's figure, even before currency factors, due to weakness in German and Australian markets, which account for 30 percent of its business, BTR said.
